ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sudden Sensorineural Hearing Loss (SSNHL)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Acute onset of unilateral hearing loss upon waking, confirmed as sensorineural by audiometry and Weber test.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Diplacusis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient reports pitch distortion (upward shift) and 'crackling' quality in the affected ear, confirmed by informal pitch matching.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Tinnitus
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient reports bilateral white noise tinnitus, lateralized to the right, accompanying the hearing loss.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To quantify hearing thresholds and confirm the nature (sensorineural vs conductive) and degree of the sudden loss.
To quickly differentiate between sensorineural and conductive loss; lateralization to the better ear supports SNHL.
To investigate the patient's complaint of pitch distortion and music sounding 'out of tune'.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Results confirm a sudden, severe sensorineural hearing loss in the right ear, sloping in the high frequencies. The Weber test corroborates a sensorineural site of lesion by lateralizing to the better (left) ear. Informal testing confirms diplacusis with an upward pitch shift in the affected ear.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Left ear normal. Right ear severe SNHL sloping from 1 to 8 kHz (reaching 75-80 dB HL at 4-8 kHz); low frequencies (250-500 Hz) mild-to-moderate (20-25 dB HL).

tests.name: Weber Test
tests.result_summary: Lateralized to the left (better ear) at 1000 and 2000 Hz.

tests.name: Informal Pitch Matching (Diplacusis check)
tests.result_summary: Music shifted upward in pitch by a full step when listening with the affected (right) ear compared to the good ear.

proposed_items: Monitoring of auditory symptoms and recovery
counseling_actions: Advise that SSNHL is a medical urgency requiring immediate adherence to the steroid regimen
Explain that 'crackling' and pitch distortion (diplacusis) are common symptoms of cochlear hair cell dysfunction
Recommend avoiding loud music or noise exposure during the recovery period
Instruct to monitor for any changes in balance or dizziness

escalation.rationale_short: Sudden Sensorineural Hearing Loss requires immediate medical evaluation and treatment (steroids) to maximize recovery potential.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor response to steroid treatment and resolution of diplacusis.

expected_outcome: Pure-tone audiometry (Recovery): Right ear thresholds improved significantly, ranging from 15-20 dB HL in low frequencies to 30-45 dB HL in high frequencies (2-8 kHz), though sensitivity remained slightly outside the normal range compared to baseline.
Subjective Report: Within 48 hours of starting prednisone, sound clarity in the affected ear returned to pre-event quality and the diplacusis sensation faded.
